intro: Clarkia eiseneana, commonly known as the Eisenean Clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Clarkia eiseneana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
